 â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ â€Œ 1.4 - DISTINGUISHABLE
LOW OR NO BACKGROUND AUDIO(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

For prerecorded audio-only content that (1) contains primarily speech in the
foreground, (2) is not an audio CAPTCHA or audio logo, and (3) is not
vocalization intended to be primarily musical expression such as singing or
rapping, at least one of the following is true: 

No Background The audio does not contain background sounds.

Turn Off The background sounds can be turned off.

20 dB The background sounds are at least 20 decibels lower than the foreground
speech content, with the exception of occasional sounds that last for only one
or two seconds. 

These websites...

Make it easier for users to see and hear content including separating foreground
from background.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
My bot couldn't find any ðŸ˜¢. But the linked pages might still have ones it
missed.

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/low-or-no-background-audio.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
